sanskrit_verse:
योऽन्यथा सन्तमात्मानमन्यथा सत्सु भाषते ।
स पापकृत्तमो लोके स्तेन आत्मापहारकः ॥ ४.२५५॥
transliteration:
yo'nyathā santam ātmānam anyathā satsu bhāṣate |
sa pāpakṛttamo loke stena ātmāpahārakaḥ || 4.255||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who misrepresents the Self that is, as something else in the presence of those who know it otherwise, commits the gravest transgression and is a thief of the Self.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from alignment with the Self
Causation arises through distortion of ontological truth
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by conscious awareness of the Self
Restoration logic requires realignment with authentic identity
executable_legal_axioms: IF an individual knowingly misrepresents their true nature to others, THEN initiate consciousness-realignment protocol
IF misrepresentation leads to societal disorientation, THEN assign completion process for integrity restoration
IF agent demonstrates persistent denial of Self-knowledge, THEN enforce capacity-assessment and reintegration cycle
IF witness recognizes misrepresentation but remains passive, THEN activate collective-consciousness reinforcement mechanism
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this principle establishes that intentional distortion of fundamental identity—whether personal or institutional—is a violation of the highest order. Responsibility is measured not by external harm but by the degree of departure from Self-knowledge. Authority flows only from those aligned with Atman; hence, misrepresentation invalidates claims to legitimate power or testimony.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality identifies the root error as false identification rather than malicious intent. The sequential manifestation begins with loss of Self-recognition, leading to misleading speech, resulting in disruption of dharma. Responsibility is proportional to the level of Self-awareness available to the actor. Non-punitive enforcement focuses on restoring access to authentic identity, not imposing corrective suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Self-recognition immersion protocol until stable alignment is restored
Assign public declaration of truthful identity under guidance of realized authority
Implement peer-group witnessing sessions to reinforce ontological clarity
Undertake completion process for all consequences arising from false representation
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Law: This Dharma restores reality to its non-punitive foundation, where justice aligns consciousness and Self-knowledge prevails over distortion. The thief of the Self is not punished, but guided back to the recognition of their own divinity.
